docs.text: i saw simon birch in a basically sold out theater , on a sunday afternoon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when the movie was over and the audience was exiting , i didn't hear one negative comment , and i didn't have any to offer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: simon birch is primarily about the friendship of two twelve year old boys , simon ( ian michael smith ) and joe ( joseph mazzello ) , and what destiny holds for both of them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: simon is a dwarf , who was not supposed to last through the night after birth due to a weak heart .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: surprisingly , he does , and now constantly reminds everyone that he is a living miracle .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: simon thinks god has a plan for him , a purpose for his life , and his condition , he just doesn't know what .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: joe is an illegitimate child ( referred to both comically and dramatically throughout the film as a bastard ) , who's mom ( ashley judd ) won't tell him who his father is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: simon has more than just dwarfism as a problem , the people in the town don't really like him , because he isn't " natural " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even his own parents don't care about him , and are disappointed they didn't have a " normal " son .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is also harassed in church by the local pastor , rev . russell ( david strathairn ) and simon's chain smoking sunday school teacher played by jan hooks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the only person , other than joe , that really cares for simon is joe's mom , who he also looks up to as a mother .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it would be just simon's luck , that he would accidentally kills joe's mom , something you are told at the beginning of the movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: joe , now motherless as well as fatherless , feels the need to find out who his real father is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with the help of ben ( oliver platt ) , the local drama teacher and joe's mom's current boyfriend ( before her death ) , he will attempt to locate his dad and get in a little trouble on the way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: most of this trouble is laugh out loud funny , although not all of it is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: simon will also look for god's plan for him , although he loses a little faith along the way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: starring in the first ( and last ) five minutes of the film is hollywood's newest dramatic actor , jim carrey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jim plays the adult version of joe and does a impressive job starting the film off , and then tying it up just right .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is the first character jim has played that is not over the top in anyway , and he does a commendable job .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: simon birch is written and directed by mark steven johnson , this is his first film as director , but he has written several films , including the grumpy old men series .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he does an outstanding writing and directing job here , the film's structure is flawless and its flows together perfectly .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the dialog goes from extremely funny to morose without missing a beat .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the cast is excellent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: joseph mazzello gives the stand out performance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: joseph is outstanding for someone of any age , not alone someone who just turned 15 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ian michael smith , in his film debut , has such a strong physical presence that you believe he is simon without any hesitation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: other great performances are turned in by the rest of the supporting cast .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i loved this movie , it is far and away one of the best films i have seen all year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: take your whole family to see simon birch , it is a magnificent film- an american masterpiece .
docs.label: positive
